intro: Henningia angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf henningia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
